result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sonny Jerone Brown

records.addlTxt:
11:02 AM Defendant Sonny Jerone Brown appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel R Skarie in court for Sonny Jerone Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
There are no victims on this case. 

Parties are still awaiting chemical testing. 

State confirms that crime lab results have not yet been received. 

Defense requests another status conference, as an offer will not be extended by the State until results are received. State does not object. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Letter dated 10/04/2022, filed by Atty Skarie, requesting a Zoom appearance for the 10/10/2022 Hearing

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/07/2022 - Approved.**
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

10:27 AM Defendant Sonny Jerone Brown in court.  Attorney Daniel R Skarie in court for Sonny Jerone Brown. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by NIkole Kane. 
There are no victims on this case. 

Defense request more time to review records and discovery. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:15 AM Defendant Sonny Jerone Brown in court with attorney Daniel R Skarie.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

State Trooper Keegan Williams, of the Wisconsin State Patrol, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Sitzberger.
Cross examination by attorney Skarie.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

The Court notes that WCS filed a letter concerning SCRAM on 06/06/2022.
The Court grants the request of WCS and will allow the SCRAM for the 90 days should the Defendant remain in compliance.
The Court take no other action and no new bond will need to be signed.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

WCS filed letter letting the court know the Defendant DOES NOT qualify the Intoxicated Driver Program due to his residence. Sent to CC Rieck to review - Court's response: Matter may be addressed at court on 7/6/2022. Until then, the base station model proposed by WCS is approved
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.   Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

01:22 PM Defendant Sonny Jerone Brown in court with attorney Daniel R Skarie.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 021990,
Payable Number: 466615,
Receipt Number: 22R 023851,
Amount: $20.00
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
